stream_context.summary: Kaze live-builds the retro "Board the Platforms" sub-area for Oily Boily Bay while experimenting with Restream. Most of the session is spent designing a 3-layer 3D skybox of transparent squares, scripting its rotation, and blocking out the first four moving platforms.

development_findings.summary: Oily Boily Bay is still in an "early" state, but its large outdoor hub and 16 custom surface types (mud, wood, steel, glass, leaves, grates, etc.) are now functional.
Each main course will contain an 8-bit sub-stage; remaining planned retro themes are Mario Paint, Dr. Mario and Super Mario Land 1 after this Smash 64 section.
development_findings.quote: We're almost out of retro games… the next level will be Mario Paint, the level after that will be Dr. Mario, and then the last one will be Mario Land 1.

development_findings.summary: The Smash 64 homage uses three concentric layers of semi-transparent squares mapped onto a high-poly sphere; layers spin at different speeds to mimic the original parallax.
development_findings.quote: It's gonna look like a high-quality version of this—one layer white, one light-green, one blue—each on its own rotation.

development_findings.summary: Kaze rejected a cheap, single-image background because N64 overdraw would cause a ~20 ms penalty; the multi-layer square method keeps fill-rate low.
development_findings.quote: If you paint it on a scrolling texture you get four times overdraw. One time overdraw is 5 ms so all four together is like 20 ms—so that would suck.

development_findings.summary: Memory pressure triggered a pipe rendering glitch; Kaze scanned segment 0F (Goombas etc.) and began trimming unused actors to free space.
He adjusted Mario64’s optional ‘snappy’ camera: base D-pad velocity lowered, acceleration curve flattened, to satisfy both precision tweaks and full rotations.
development_findings.quote: Maybe I need to change the curve of this… people that use it as a slow rotation button won’t be pro players, so they won’t mind a bit more startup.

development_findings.summary: Upcoming course concepts: Wild West Valley (boss-hunt), an undefined music world, an oversized casino, and a comic-book metropolis where Mario plays a superhero.
All area music has already been composed by Badub; Kaze labels the tracks “bangers.”
development_findings.quote: We already have songs for all these areas from Badub and the songs are a banger.

context_findings.summary: Kaze recently moved into a house and streams from a combined office/home gym; lifting 242 lb bench press is part of his daily routine.
context_findings.quote: We moved to a house recently… that’s my bench—242 pounds plus the bar.

context_findings.summary: He now works full-time at Gears for Breakfast (A Hat in Time) which limits hack dev time.
context_findings.quote: Either way I work at Gears for Breakfast now… I just don’t get any free time.

context_findings.summary: He returned to Twitch only after finding a reliable ad-blocker and now multistreams because Twitch TOS allows it; sees value in pitting platforms against each other for engagement.
context_findings.quote: This also means I can make both YouTube and Twitch fight against each other… that’s insane engagement.

context_findings.summary: A viral trailer brought unexpected positive feedback; he hopes for a 2024 release but is unsure.
context_findings.quote: Game of the year 2024—I hope I can release it 2024, I don't actually know.

context_findings.summary: He dislikes Lego Fortnite (“miserable”) and finds Studio Ghibli films boring—insight into his taste.
Received an unexpected €200 donation mid-stream and felt guilty for missing the alert—shows reliance on community funding.
context_findings.quote: Someone just donated 200 euros… how did I miss that? That is definitely helping.

biobak.summary: Appears in chat, noting multistream return; no specific work discussed in this session.

badub.summary: All current level songs are complete and praised as high quality.

zeina.summary: Provides chat feedback, notes Twitch is working; brief on-stream visit before leaving.

key_stories.title: Building the Smash 64 Skybox
key_stories.summary: Kaze abandons a simple flat texture idea for the "Board the Platforms" background and invents a three-layer rotating sphere of transparent squares.
key_stories.challenge: A single image background caused performance and visual fidelity issues.
key_stories.process: Modeled a 64×32 UV sphere, cut out square patterns, wrote custom GEO ASM to rotate each layer at independent speeds while minimizing overdraw.
key_stories.outcome: Achieved a faithful but efficient N64-ready effect; only final fade/edge treatment remains.
key_stories.key_quote: It's gonna look like a high-quality version of this—foreground, midground, background—all real geometry.

key_stories.title: Camera Tweaks for Dual Use
key_stories.summary: Chat complained D-pad nudges were too ‘sine-eased.’ Kaze live-tuned velocity and acceleration to balance micro-adjustments and full rotations.
key_stories.challenge: Small taps moved the camera inconsistently; power-users wanted precision.
key_stories.process: Exposed constants, reduced base acceleration, kept long-hold ramp, tested in emulator.
key_stories.key_quote: People who want slow rotation aren’t pro players, so they won’t mind a bit more startup.

key_stories.title: Missed Mega-Donation
key_stories.summary: A €200 Streamlabs tip went unnoticed for thirty minutes due to broken alerts.
key_stories.process: Chat pointed it out; Kaze searched dashboards, apologized, and reflected on alert system.
key_stories.outcome: Plans to restore notifications to honor supporter contributions.
key_stories.key_quote: Someone just donated 200 euros… how did I miss that?
